<div class="c6 " style="margin-bottom:7px">
<!-- <![endif]-->
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
JOBS
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/06/05/may-jobs-report-gives-cause-optimism?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Everyone Reading the Jobs Report Yesterday
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<img alt="Mr. Krabs" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC8xMjQxL21yX2tyYWJzLnBuZyIsImJ1Y2tldCI6Im9zbG8tcHJvZHVjdGlvbiIsImVkaXRzIjp7InJlc2l6ZSI6eyJ3aWR0aCI6MTAwMCwiaGVpZ2h0IjpudWxsfX19">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Know Your Meme</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">U.S. employers <a href="https://apnews.com/9358e14389c7d8e11c3a6a4beb366411?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">added 2.5 million jobs</a> in May and the unemployment rate <em>dropped </em>to 13.3% from 14.7% in May.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">It might be the biggest upset since Appalachian State knocked off Michigan. Many economists predicted the unemployment rate would surge to 20% or more given the wide-scale destruction COVID-19 inflicted on the economy. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Instead, May gave us the biggest monthly jobs gain on record. </p>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">Let’s dive into the numbers…</h2>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>
</span><span><strong style="color:#000">By industry: </strong></span><span>Hotels and restaurants, which suffered the worst of the damage from lockdowns, added 1.2 million jobs in May after losing 7.5 million in April. Retailers also tacked on 368,000 jobs following dramatic cuts. </span>
</li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>
</span><span><strong style="color:#000">By race: </strong></span><span>The unemployment rate among African Americans and Asians ticked up in May; for white and Latino workers it decreased.</span>
</li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>
</span><span><strong style="color:#000">By gender: </strong></span><span>Women, who had been making </span><span><a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/01/10/women-hold-majority-jobs-december?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">historic gains</a></span><span> in the job market pre-pandemic, have been </span><span><a href="https://www.nytimes.com/2020/06/03/business/economy/coronavirus-working-women.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">disproportionately hurt</a></span><span> by this economic crisis. In May, the employment rate for women was 14.5%, compared to 12.2% for men. </span>
</li>
</ul>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">What to make of it all?</h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Experts say the labor market is on a sugar high from the trillions in government stimulus that was poured in to blunt the economic impact of the shutdowns. And all good highs wear off eventually...</p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Many of May’s job gains can be attributed to businesses calling up the employees they laid off and telling them to come back to work once they got the green light from the government.</span></li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>21 million workers are still unemployed, the unemployment rate is at a level not seen </span><span><a href="https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2020-06-05/u-s-jobless-rate-unexpectedly-fell-in-may-as-hiring-rebounded?sref=KkPzpZvz&utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">since 1940</a></span><span>, and the emergency government aid will gradually wear off.  </span>
</li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Bottom line: </strong>Economists are giving their crystal balls an extra scrub this weekend, but they’re certain a full recovery in the labor market is years away. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">+ Bonus: </strong>2020 will be remembered for a lot of reasons, but one of them will be for giving us charts that look like this.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><img src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC8xMjQyL2NyYXp5X2pvYnNfY2hhcnQucG5nIiwiYnVja2V0Ijoib3Nsby1wcm9kdWN0aW9uIn0=" class="img-responsive" width="640" style="width:100% !important;max-width: 640px; width: 100%;" alt="" data-reactroot=""></p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;line-height: 22px;"><small> <em>Axios</em> </small></p>

<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
SOCIAL MEDIA
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/06/05/reddit-cofounder-leaves-board-calls-black-candidate-replace?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Leading by Leaving
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<img alt="Alexis Ohanian" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC8xMjM5L2FsZXhpc19vaGFuaWFuLmpwZyIsImJ1Y2tldCI6Im9zbG8tcHJvZHVjdGlvbiIsImVkaXRzIjp7InJlc2l6ZSI6eyJ3aWR0aCI6MTAwMCwiaGVpZ2h0IjpudWxsfX19">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Paul Kane/Getty Images</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">✌—Reddit cofounder Alexis Ohanian.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Yesterday, Ohanian resigned from the company's board and <a href="https://alexisohanian.com/home/2020/6/5/what-did-you-do?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">urged it</a> to replace him with a black candidate. He said he'll use future gains on his Reddit stock to "serve the black community," and pledged $1 million to Colin Kaepernick’s Know Your Rights Camp. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Zoom out:</strong> Reddit, like its big brothers Facebook and Twitter, has found itself at the center of censorship debates. </p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>Former Reddit President Ellen Pao </span><span><a href="https://twitter.com/ekp/status/1267689503797342208?s=20&utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">criticized</a></span><span> Reddit’s current CEO Steve Huffman for not shutting down r/The_Donald, the Reddit channel for Donald Trump supporters. "You don't get to say BLM when reddit nurtures and monetizes white supremacy and hate all day long," she tweeted.</span>
</li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Huffman has said the company is exploring solutions, while Republican lawmakers threatened legal action if the company censors the channel.</span></li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Ohanian, who is married to tennis icon Serena Williams, is trying to stay above the fray. “I’m writing this as a father who needs to be able to answer his black daughter when she asks: ‘What did you do?’” he wrote on his blog.</p>

<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding-top: 12px;">
<a href="https://www.facebook.com/sharer/sharer.php?u=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.morningbrew.com%2Fdaily%2Fstories%2F2020%2F06%2F05%2Freddit-cofounder-leaves-board-calls-black-candidate-replace" target="_blank" rel="noopener" style="text-decoration: none;" class="">
<img alt="" style="display: inline-block; width: 25px" width="25" src="https://media.sailthru.com/5z8/1k4/4/2/5e865734bf6f7.jpg">
</a><span>  </span>

<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
INVESTING
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/06/05/individual-investors-bullish-money-managers?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Day Traders > Paid Traders
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<!--[if mso]>
<img alt="Drake GIF" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" height=377 src="https://media.giphy.com/media/geFKsylvUiUtH0i4wK/giphy.gif">
<![endif]-->
<!--[if !mso]>--><!-- -->
<img class="story-header-image" alt="Drake GIF" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" src="https://media.giphy.com/media/geFKsylvUiUtH0i4wK/giphy.gif">
<!--<![endif]-->
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Giphy/Toby Howell</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">As the stock market bounces back in <a href="https://www.cnbc.com/2020/06/03/this-is-the-greatest-50-day-rally-in-the-history-of-the-sp-500.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">historic fashion</a>, a noticeable gap has emerged between the relative hype levels of individual and institutional investors. </p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>In a </span><span><a href="https://www.ft.com/content/895c6c85-a85e-4786-8d7e-7d32e612e08a?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Financial Times/Savanta poll</a></span><span>, 71% of U.K.-based wealth managers said their clients bought stock after the market plunged. </span>
</li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Contrast that with views of the managers themselves—only 4% think the FTSE 100 (the benchmark U.K. stock index) will rise above a certain level this year.  </span></li>
</ul>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">Just look at airlines</h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">JETS, the once-tiny exchange-traded fund (ETF) tracking major airlines, has seen a <a href="https://fortune.com/2020/06/03/airline-etf-jets-assets-soar/?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">massive inflow of money</a> from day traders since the coronavirus pandemic sent airline stocks spiraling in March.  </p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>The number of Robinhood users holding JETS grew to nearly 30,000 this past week, pushing the fund past $1 billion in assets.</span></li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Meanwhile, Warren Buffett dropped all his U.S. airline stocks during the pandemic.</span></li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Bottom line:</strong> The WSJ argues that memories of <a href="https://www.wsj.com/articles/are-memories-of-2009-adding-fuel-to-the-market-fire-11591356262?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">2009’s stock rally</a> have individual investors keen to “buy the dip” this time around. And with trading apps like Robinhood <a href="https://www.cnbc.com/2020/05/12/young-investors-pile-into-stocks-seeing-generational-buying-moment-instead-of-risk.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">skyrocketing in popularity</a>, hordes of eager investors are just a few taps away. </p>

<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">

<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">

<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
TELECOM
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/06/05/india-telecom-giant-jio-attracts-huge-investments?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Everyone’s Gung-Ho for Jio
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding-right:15px;padding-bottom:15px;padding-left:15px;padding-top:0px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Like Adam Sandler’s dramatic acting abilities, India's Jio Platforms has gone from under-the-radar to the talk of the town. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Yesterday, a group led by private equity firm Silver Lake Partners agreed to invest an <a href="https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2020-06-05/silver-lake-invests-another-602-million-in-indian-tycoon-s-jio?sref=KkPzpZvz&utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">additional $602 million</a> in Jio on top of the $750 million investment Silver Lake already made last month. Jio is the digital arm of Reliance Industries, an Indian conglomerate and the country's most valuable firm.</p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>This news comes on the heels of Abu Dhabi’s sovereign wealth fund investing $1.2 billion in Jio on Thursday...which comes on the heels of a $1.5 billion investment from private equity firm KKR in May...which comes on the heels of Facebook pouring in $5.7 billion in April. </span></li>
</ul>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">What's all the fuss?</h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Jio is an entry point into India’s telecom market which is, in a word, ginormous—its 600 million internet users is second only to China. </p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>Jio bet big on </span><span><a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/emerging-tech/stories/2020/06/01/microsoft-reportedly-mulls-investment-jio-platforms?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">providing cheap 4G service</a></span><span> for customers, but the more than $12 billion it’s raised in the past two months shows that investors are also interested in its e-commerce, payments, and 5G potential. </span>
</li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Bottom line:</strong> Remember the name.</p>

ENVIRONMENT
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/06/05/co2-levels-hit-highest-record-mauna-loa?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Checking In on the Climate...
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>

<img alt="CO2 levels" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC8xMjM3L2NvMl9sZXZlbHMucG5nIiwiYnVja2V0Ijoib3Nsby1wcm9kdWN0aW9uIiwiZWRpdHMiOnsicmVzaXplIjp7IndpZHRoIjoxMDAwLCJoZWlnaHQiOm51bGx9fX0=">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>NOAA</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Oof. You’d think our two months of jigsaw puzzles and Rube Goldberg machines would show up in pollution measurements, but not really—CO2 levels in the atmosphere hit a <a href="https://research.noaa.gov/article/ArtMID/587/ArticleID/2636/Rise-of-carbon-dioxide-unabated?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">fresh record</a> in May at the Mauna Loa Observatory in Hawaii. </p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>“The buildup of CO2 is a bit like trash in a landfill. As we keep emitting, it keeps piling up,” said geochemist Ralph Keeling.</span></li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>“The crisis has slowed emissions, but not enough to show up perceptibly at Mauna Loa. What will matter much more is the trajectory we take coming out of this situation.” </span></li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">+ If you’re looking to get away from it all...</strong>head to the Southern Ocean directly south of Australia. There, scientists have discovered the <a href="https://cosmosmagazine.com/earth/earth-sciences/scientists-identify-the-cleanest-air-on-earth/?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">“cleanest” air on Earth</a>, completely free of aerosols generated by human activity.</p>

<img alt="Virtual world" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC84ODIvdmlydHVhbF93b3JsZC5qcGciLCJidWNrZXQiOiJvc2xvLXByb2R1Y3Rpb24iLCJlZGl0cyI6eyJyZXNpemUiOnsid2lkdGgiOjEwMDAsImhlaWdodCI6bnVsbH19fQ==">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Francis Scialabba</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">This spring, we've spent Saturday newsletters exploring the various ways COVID-19 will (or will not) fundamentally transform some industries. You can dive into our previous editions here:</p>
<ol>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span><a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/04/24/future-cities?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">The future of cities</a></span></li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span><a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/05/01/whats-next-big-tech?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Big Tech</a></span></li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span><a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/05/08/virtual-worlds-stay?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Virtual worlds</a></span></li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span><a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/05/15/higher-ed-will-never?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Higher ed</a></span></li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span><a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/05/22/travel-pandemicera-world?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Travel</a></span></li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>
</span><span><a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/05/29/remote-work-destiny?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Remote work</a></span><span> </span>
</li>
</ol>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">What other topics or industries do you think we should cover in this series? <a href="https://morningbrewdaily.typeform.com/to/Drb1FE?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Share your suggestions here</a>. </p>
</td>

<td style="padding-right:15px;padding-bottom:15px;padding-left:15px;padding-top:0px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Theme parks are slowly reopening, and as they adjust to a new reality, some truly odd stories caught our eye. But one of these theme-park-themed headlines is a little too far-fetched. Can you spot the fake?</p>

</li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>"'</span><span><a href="https://www.insider.com/disney-world-social-distancing-star-wars-stormtroopers-2020-6?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Star Wars' stormtroopers</a></span><span> are enforcing new social distancing rules at Disney World"</span>
</li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>"No people? No problem. Theme park uses </span><span><a href="https://www.theolympian.com/news/coronavirus/article243230651.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">giant teddies</a></span><span> to test California coaster"</span>
</li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>"Six Flags set to </span><span><a href="https://media.giphy.com/media/SrmLZIT3S8oFO/giphy.gif?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">lower height standards</a></span><span> in hopes of attracting younger customers"</span>
</li>
</ol>

<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Written by
<a href="https://twitter.com/tobydoyhowell" class="link" target="_blank" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Toby Howell</a> and <a href="https://twitter.com/Neal_Freyman" class="link" target="_blank" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Neal Freyman</a>

style=\"padding:15px\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eU.S. employers \u003ca href=\"https://apnews.com/9358e14389c7d8e11c3a6a4beb366411?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eadded 2.5 million jobs\u003c/a\u003e in May and the unemployment rate \u003cem\u003edropped \u003c/em\u003eto 13.3% from 14.7% in May.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eIt might be the biggest upset since Appalachian State knocked off Michigan. Many economists predicted the unemployment rate would surge to 20% or more given the wide-scale destruction COVID-19 inflicted on the economy. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eInstead, May gave us the biggest monthly jobs gain on record. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003ch2 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0\"\u003eLet’s dive into the numbers…\u003c/h2\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003e\n\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eBy industry: \u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003eHotels and restaurants, which suffered the worst of the damage from lockdowns, added 1.2 million jobs in May after losing 7.5 million in April. Retailers also tacked on 368,000 jobs following dramatic cuts. \u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003e\n\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eBy race: \u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003eThe unemployment rate among African Americans and Asians ticked up in May; for white and Latino workers it decreased.\u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003e\n\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eBy gender: \u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003eWomen, who had been making \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/01/10/women-hold-majority-jobs-december?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ehistoric gains\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e in the job market pre-pandemic, have been \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://www.nytimes.com/2020/06/03/business/economy/coronavirus-working-women.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003edisproportionately hurt\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e by this economic crisis. In May, the employment rate for women was 14.5%, compared to 12.2% for men. \u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003ch2 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0\"\u003eWhat to make of it all?\u003c/h2\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eExperts say the labor market is on a sugar high from the trillions in government stimulus that was poured in to blunt the economic impact of the shutdowns. And all good highs wear off eventually...\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eMany of May’s job gains can be attributed to businesses calling up the employees they laid off and telling them to come back to work once they got the green light from the government.\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003e21 million workers are still unemployed, the unemployment rate is at a level not seen \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2020-06-05/u-s-jobless-rate-unexpectedly-fell-in-may-as-hiring-rebounded?sref=KkPzpZvz\u0026utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003esince 1940\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e, and the emergency government aid will gradually wear off.  \u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eBottom line: \u003c/strong\u003eEconomists are giving their crystal balls an extra scrub this weekend, but they’re certain a full recovery in the labor market is years away. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding:15px\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e✌—Reddit cofounder Alexis Ohanian.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eYesterday, Ohanian resigned from the company's board and \u003ca href=\"https://alexisohanian.com/home/2020/6/5/what-did-you-do?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eurged it\u003c/a\u003e to replace him with a black candidate. He said he'll use future gains on his Reddit stock to \"serve the black community,\" and pledged $1 million to Colin Kaepernick’s Know Your Rights Camp. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eZoom out:\u003c/strong\u003e Reddit, like its big brothers Facebook and Twitter, has found itself at the center of censorship debates. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003eFormer Reddit President Ellen Pao \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://twitter.com/ekp/status/1267689503797342208?s=20\u0026utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ecriticized\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e Reddit’s current CEO Steve Huffman for not shutting down r/The_Donald, the Reddit channel for Donald Trump supporters. \"You don't get to say BLM when reddit nurtures and monetizes white supremacy and hate all day long,\" she tweeted.\u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eHuffman has said the company is exploring solutions, while Republican lawmakers threatened legal action if the company censors the channel.\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eOhanian, who is married to tennis icon Serena Williams, is trying to stay above the fray. “I’m writing this as a father who needs to be able to answer his black daughter when she asks: ‘What did you do?’” he wrote on his blog.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c!-- SOCIAL LINKS --\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0\"\u003eJust look at airlines\u003c/h2\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eJETS, the once-tiny exchange-traded fund (ETF) tracking major airlines, has seen a \u003ca href=\"https://fortune.com/2020/06/03/airline-etf-jets-assets-soar/?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eThe number of Robinhood users holding JETS grew to nearly 30,000 this past style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eLike Adam Sandler’s dramatic acting abilities, India's Jio Platforms has gone from under-the-radar to the talk of the style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eOof. You’d think our two months of jigsaw puzzles and Rube Goldberg machines would show up in pollution measurements, but not really—CO2 levels in the atmosphere hit a \u003ca href=\"https://research.noaa.gov/article/ArtMID/587/ArticleID/2636/Rise-of-carbon-dioxide-unabated?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003efresh record\u003c/a\u003e in May at the Mauna Loa Observatory in Hawaii. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003e“The buildup of CO2 is a bit like trash in a landfill. As we keep emitting, it keeps piling up,” said geochemist Ralph Keeling.\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003e“The crisis has slowed emissions, but not enough to show up perceptibly at Mauna Loa. What will matter much more is the trajectory we take coming out of this situation.” \u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003e+ If you’re looking to get away from it all...\u003c/strong\u003ehead to the Southern Ocean directly south of Australia.
